intro: Froelichia campestris, commonly known as the field hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant features showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink or red, with five petals and a prominent central stigma. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and have a slightly rough texture.
